newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 15.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 15.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Tuesday's Daily Variety:
* Arnold Rifkin has been named president of the William Morris Agency, joining Norman Brokaw, Jerry Katzman and Walter Zifkin in the agency's management team.

* Despite round-the-clock efforts under way to complete "Titanic's" complex computer-generated effects, it is uncertain whether director James Cameron's big-budget film will be ready by its July 2 release date.
* Hollywood studios garnered $4.9 billion in worldwide film rentals, seven percent more than last year, according to Motion Picture Association of America data.
* When Jack Rapke, co-chairman of Creative Artists Agency, left the agency business last week, rival agents began discussing which clients could be pried loose from the agency.
* Walt Disney's ABC has signed a deal with Hallmark Entertainment for a series of plays for television on the new century.
* For his initial project under a deal with News Corp 20th Century Fox, Harold Ramis will write, direct and co-produce a remake of Stanley Donen's 1967 comedy, Bedazzled.
* DIC Entertainment has reached agreement with Archie Comics to acquire the animation production and worldwide licensing rights to the company's characters from Riverdale.
